translation.en: ♪ We're gonna make it home ♪
translation.ja: イリノイ州 シカゴ

translation.en: -♪ We're gonna make it home... ♪ -Run complete.
[automated voice] Well done, Emily. Five point three miles. Forty-one minutes.
translation.ja: エミリー 8.5キロを41分で完走しました

translation.en: Eighteen seconds faster than yesterday.
translation.ja: 昨日より18秒 速いです

translation.en: -Good effort. -[exhales]
-[indistinct chatter] -[gasps] Madeline, you're in Adweek.
translation.ja: あなたがアドウィークに

translation.en: What? Where?
Right here, under "Movers and Shakers."
-[Madeline] Ah! -"Chicago-based Gilbert Group expands international portfolio
translation.ja: “シカゴを拠点とするギルバート･グループは”

translation.en: with acquisition of French luxury marketing company Savoir.
translation.ja: “フランスのマーケティング企業を買収”

translation.en: Gilbert Group vet, Madeline Wheeler,
named director of marketing for Franco firm."
translation.ja: “サヴォワールのマーケティング部長に就任”

translation.en: Yes! I am here to prove that a master's in French does not go to waste.
translation.ja: フランス語の修士号が役に立つ時が来た

translation.en: -This is going to be amazing for you. -[Madeline sighs]
I have been dreaming of moving to Paris forever.
translation.ja: パリに住むのが夢だった

translation.en: I mean, French men, they love older women, you know?
translation.ja: 年上の女がモテるでしょ

translation.en: Look at their president. He's young. He's hot. -He married his schoolteacher. -[Emily laughs]
translation.ja: 大統領だって若いのに元恩師と結婚した

translation.en: Ooh, I just emailed you my thoughts on the presentation for the new IBS drug.
translation.ja: 過敏性腸症候群の薬の件はメールしました

translation.en: It's a social initiative to add meditation to your medication.
translation.ja: 瞑想(めいそう)を治療に取り入れる新しい試みです

translation.en: If you like it, you can pitch it later. Uh, you know, for your last hurrah.
translation.ja: ここでのあなたの最後の仕事

translation.en: -I want you to pitch it. -Seriously?
translation.ja: あなたがやって 本気？

translation.en: Seriously. The client has to start getting comfortable with you.
translation.ja: ええ顧客もあなたなら安心よ

translation.en: I don't want to step on your toes.
You're not. You're stepping into my shoes. You're ready, okay?
translation.ja: 私の後を継ぐのいいチャンスでしょ

translation.en: This is an opportunity for both of us. Come here. Try this.
translation.ja: 私の後を継ぐのいいチャンスでしょ 来て

translation.en: What is it?
De L'Heure.
It's the latest fragrance from Maison Lavaux.
translation.ja: メゾン･ラヴォーの新作の香水

translation.en: I'll be handling them, their account in Paris. What do you think?
translation.ja: パリの顧客の商品よどう？

translation.en: It's like wearing poetry.
translation.ja: ポエムをまとったよう

translation.en: [snaps fingers] I'm gonna use that.
Oh, that smells really wei-- Does that smell weird to you?
translation.ja: 何これ　変な匂いじゃない？

translation.en: -No, just floral. -But...
translation.ja: 花の香りです でも…

translation.en: I'm gonna be sick. Uh... I'm gonna be sick.
translation.ja: ダメだわ　吐きそう

translation.en: -Hi, babe! -[boyfriend] Hey. Oh.
-Yes! -What happened?
Bote just smacked a walk-off grand slam, two outs left in the bottom of the ninth.
translation.ja: ９回裏２アウトからの逆転ホームランだ

translation.en: -Oh, my God! -Hell yeah!
Yeah! Cubs are goin' to the playoffs, baby!
translation.ja: シカゴ･カブスが決勝進出だ

translation.en: -Can we get a couple of beers here? -[Emily] White wine, actually.
translation.ja: ビールをくれ フランス産の白ワインがいい

translation.en: -Anything French, if you have it. -[server] For sure.
translation.ja: フランス産の白ワインがいい はい

translation.en: I have some crazy news.
-Madeline's pregnant. -Madeline?
translation.ja: マデリンが妊娠した 上司の？

translation.en: -[Emily] Mm-hm. -Like, your boss, Madeline?
translation.ja: 年齢的に妊娠は無理かと思った

translation.en: -Thought she was too old to get pregnant. -Well, so did she.
translation.ja: 年齢的に妊娠は無理かと思った 本人もそう

translation.en: Until she got completely nauseous sniffing this perfume
translation.ja: 香水の匂いで吐き気を催すまではね

translation.en: she was planning to promote. She went to the doctor this afternoon.
translation.ja: 香水の匂いで吐き気を催すまではね その後 病院に

translation.en: -Wow. So, who's the dad? -Oh, well, there are a few candidates.
translation.ja: 父親は？ 何人か候補がいるいろんな人と寝てるから

translation.en: -She was having a lot of going-away sex. -Hey. Go, Madeline.
translation.ja: 何人か候補がいるいろんな人と寝てるから さすがだ

translation.en: But now that she's pregnant, she's decided she's not gonna take the job in Paris.
translation.ja: それと彼女はパリ行きの仕事を断った

translation.en: So, there goes your promotion?
[Emily] Not exactly. They still need someone there.
translation.ja: 代わりに誰かがパリに行く

translation.en: Like, American eyes and ears to help with the whole transition.
translation.ja: アメリカの情報に詳しい人がね

translation.en: So they asked me if I would take the job...
translation.ja: それで私に声がかかった

translation.en: for a year.
What? In Paris? [chuckles]
They said that if I did that they'd guarantee me senior brand manager when I'm back.
translation.ja: １年後の昇進を約束してくれるって

translation.en: So, the apartment there is already all set up, and there's a relocation bonus.
translation.ja: アパートは手配済みで転勤手当ても出る

translation.en: And just to explore the idea, here's a spreadsheet I made for the next year.
translation.ja: それと年間の予定表を考えてみたの

translation.en: Weeks when you might be able to come to Paris, times I can come back to Chicago,
translation.ja: あなたはパリに数週間 滞在私も何度かシカゴに帰る

translation.en: taking into consideration vacation and sick days.
translation.ja: 休暇と病欠を使ってね

translation.en: Wait.
You're serious?
I know it's crazy, but when will we get a chance like this?
translation.ja: バカみたいだけど こんなチャンスは逃せない

translation.en: -It'll be an adventure. -[boyfriend] Unless I missed something,
translation.ja: こんなチャンスは逃せない だけどフランス語は話せないだろ？

translation.en: you don't speak French.
translation.ja: だけどフランス語は話せないだろ？

translation.en: Fake it till you make it. [chuckles]
You look worried.
Oh, I'm not worried. It's the French who should be worried.
translation.ja: してない フランス語以外はね

translation.en: -Uh, Emily Cooper? -[Emily] Yes.
Hey. I'm Gilles Dufour from the rental agency.
translation.ja: 不動産会社のジル･デュフォーです

translation.en: -I've got your keys. Apartment 501. -["Summer in Paris" playing]
translation.ja: これが部屋の鍵501号室です

translation.en: -Hi. -♪ A s'il vous plaît ♪
-♪ Goes a long way... ♪ -The building is very old.
translation.ja: 古い建物なのでエレベーターがない

translation.en: -It doesn't have an elevator. -[panting] Okay.
translation.ja: 古い建物なのでエレベーターがない 分かった

translation.en: It's charming. [grunts]
[groans] Is this it?
[panting] It's on the fifth floor.
-This is the fourth floor. -[Emily] Uh,
I just schlepped up these bags five flights. -This is the fifth floor. -[Gilles sighs]
translation.ja: ５階分 上がったと思うけど

translation.en: In France, first the ground floor,
translation.ja: フランスでは１階を地階

translation.en: then the first floor, then the second floor, and so on.
That's weird.
Your magnificent chambre de bonne.
translation.ja: ここが“シャンブル･ド･ボンヌ”

translation.en: Chambre de what now?
Chambre de b-- Um, it means, uh, the room for the housekeeper.
translation.ja: 女中部屋という意味です

translation.en: The top two floors were typically reserved for the servants.
translation.ja: 上階の部屋は使用人が使っていました

translation.en: The space is small, but the view...
Oh, my God, I feel like Nicole Kidman in Moulin Rouge!
translation.ja: 「ムーラン･ルージュ」のニコールになった気分

translation.en: You've got all of Paris at your feet.
There is a wonderful café just down below. -A friend of mine is the manager. -[Emily] Wow.
translation.ja: あそこにあるのは友人のカフェ

translation.en: -So, ça va ? It's good? -[Emily takes a deep breath]
Oui. Oui. Très good.
-Très wonderful. [chuckles] -Great.
Are you hungry? Would you like to have a coffee or...?
translation.ja: 食事は？ コーヒーでもいかが？

translation.en: Oh, actually, I have to get to my office.
Oh. Maybe you want to have a drink tonight?
translation.ja: 夜 飲みに行くのは？

translation.en: I have a boyfriend.
-In Paris? -[Emily] In Chicago.
-So you don't have a boyfriend in Paris. -[both chuckle]
translation.ja: パリにはいないんですね

translation.en: -Can I just get my keys, s'il vous plaît ? -[Gilles] Yeah.
translation.ja: 鍵をもらえる？ もちろん

translation.en: Um, my number is on the card if you need me for anything,
translation.ja: 僕の番号です気が変わったら連絡を

translation.en: -and in case you change your mind. -I won't.
translation.ja: 僕の番号です気が変わったら連絡を しない

translation.en: -Bye-bye, now. -Yeah.
-["Lunatique" playing] -[camera shutter clicks]
translation.ja: “＠EMILYCOOPER(エミリー･クーパー)フォロワー 48人”

translation.en: Hi. Hello.
Uh, bonjour. I'm Emily Cooper from the Gilbert Group in Chicago.
translation.ja: ギルバート･グループのエミリー･クーパーです

translation.en: You are? [chuckles] I'm sorry. I don't understand.
translation.ja: ごめん 分からないや

translation.en: -I'm going to be working in this office. -[cell phone beeps]
-[line beeps] -[in French] The American girl is here.
I wasn't expecting you until tomorrow.
How was your journey here? The new apartment and everything?
translation.ja: 〈フライトはどうだった？部屋は見た？〉

translation.en: [in English, chuckling] You lost me at bonjour.
Yeah, I was told the American coming here spoke French.
translation.ja: フランス語が話せると聞いてた

translation.en: Oh, that was Madeline.
Oh, so you're not Madeline.
Uh, I'm Emily. Emily Cooper. And I am so excited to be here.
translation.ja: エミリー･クーパーですここに来られてうれしい

translation.en: Well, that's very unfortunate. [sighs softly]
-Excuse me? -That you don't speak French.
translation.ja: なぜ？ フランス語を話せないと困る

translation.en: It's a problem.
translation.ja: フランス語を話せないと困る

translation.en: Well, I'm going to take a class, but...
[American accent] ...je parle un peu français already.
Well, perhaps it's better not to try.
-[knocking on door] -Oh, Paul.
May I introduce Emily, the American girl who's come to work with us?
translation.ja: アメリカから来たエミリーよ一緒に働くの

translation.en: This is Monsieur Brossard, he's the founder of Savoir.
translation.ja: 彼は創業者のブロサール氏

translation.en: -Ah. Emily Cooper. Oh. -[Paul] Hello.
translation.ja: エミリーです どうも

translation.en: It is so nice to meet you, Monsieur Brossard.
translation.ja: お会いできて光栄です

translation.en: It's a pleasure. Welcome to Paris.
So, you've come to teach the French some American tricks?
translation.ja: アメリカ流のコツを教えに来たのか？

translation.en: I'm sure we have a lot to learn from each other.
But your experience is not with fashion
translation.ja: でも君はファッション業界の経験がない

translation.en: -and luxury brands, hm? -[Emily] True.
translation.ja: でも君はファッション業界の経験がない 確かに

translation.en: Most of my experience has been in promoting pharmaceuticals and geriatric care facilities.
translation.ja: 医薬品や高齢者施設の担当でした

translation.en: In Chicago.
Yes. I mean, oui.
I was in Chicago once, -and I ate the deep-dish pizza. -Ah.
translation.ja: 昔 シカゴで深皿のピザを食べた

translation.en: That is our specialty. We take a lot of pride.
translation.ja: シカゴ自慢の名物料理です

translation.en: It was, uh, dégueulasse. How you say?
translation.ja: あれは“デグラス”だった

translation.en: -Disgusting. -[Paul chuckles]
-Like a quiche made of cement. -Uh...
translation.ja: セメントのキッシュだな

translation.en: Oh, no, you must have gone to Lou Malnati's.
translation.ja: きっとチェーン店かも

translation.en: And the people are so fat. Why are they all so fat?
translation.ja: それに みんな肥満なのはなぜだ？

translation.en: Well, perhaps from the disgusting food.
True, we are in the midst of an obesity epidemic.
translation.ja: 確かに肥満は問題です

translation.en: In fact, Merck was one of our biggest clients. They make a diabetes drug that we marketed the heck out of.
translation.ja: メルクの糖尿病の薬は私たちのおかげで

translation.en: Sales went up 63 percent.
So you create the disease, then you treat the disease,
translation.ja: 自ら生み出した病気の治療薬を

translation.en: and then you market the treatments of the disease.
translation.ja: 自分たちで宣伝するのか

translation.en: -Well... -Perhaps stop eating.
translation.ja: それは… 食べなきゃいい

translation.en: -There is no money in that. -True.
translation.ja: タダでできる そうよ

translation.en: Cigarettes cause diabetes and cancer.
translation.ja: たばこも糖尿病やがんの原因に

translation.en: Yes. [chuckles] Well, smoking is a pleasure.
translation.ja: ああ　でも喫煙は娯楽だ

translation.en: And without pleasure, who are we?
translation.ja: 娯楽なしで生きられる？

translation.en: -German? -[Paul chuckling]
Exactly right.
All of the brands we market here, from perfume to cognac to couture,
translation.ja: うちで扱うのは香水やクチュール

translation.en: -are all to do with beauty and refinement. -[Emily] Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: 美しくて品があるものだ

translation.en: Perhaps you have something to learn from us,
translation.ja: 君はいろいろ学べるだろう

translation.en: but I'm not sure if we have much to learn from you.
translation.ja: でも君から学ぶことはあるかな

translation.en: With all due respect, I have been sent here for a reason,
translation.ja: 私にもできることはあります

translation.en: so if you wouldn't mind, I would really like to share some of my ideas about your social media strategies.
translation.ja: ＳＮＳ戦略の見直しについて助言するとか

translation.en: You mean the Twitter and the Snapchat?
Yes. And the Instagram.
Ah, by all means.
[clicks tongue] First, let me apologize for speaking English.
translation.ja: フランス語でなくてすみません

translation.en: I did Rosetta Stone on the plane, but it hasn't kicked in yet.
translation.ja: まだ習得できてないので

translation.en: -[Paul sighs] -Oh, Patricia doesn't speak English.
translation.ja: パトリシアは英語がダメ

translation.en: Please continue.
For those of you who haven't met me, I'm Emily Cooper, and I'm so excited to be here in Paris.
translation.ja: 私はエミリー･クーパーパリに来られてうれしいです

translation.en: I'm looking forward to getting to know each and every one of you
translation.ja: みんなのことを知りたいし

translation.en: and, likewise, having you get to know me.
translation.ja: 私のことも知ってほしい

translation.en: Your name, monsieur?
My name is Luc.
Yes, Luc?
Why are you shouting?
[sighs, quietly] Sorry.
Your company works with some of the biggest brands in the luxury sector, from Chanel to YSL.
translation.ja: 御社はシャネルなどの高級ブランドを扱ってる

translation.en: And that makes Savoir, your company, or, if I may be so bold,
translation.ja: だからサヴォワール― つまり“我が社”自体がブランドと言えます

translation.en: our company, a brand in itself.
translation.ja: つまり“我が社”自体がブランドと言えます

translation.en: But to build a brand, you must create meaningful social media engagement.
translation.ja: そこでＳＮＳを活用するんです

translation.en: May I ask who's responsible for your social media here?
Patricia.
Makes sense.
[inhales sharply] Anyway, it's not just about the number of followers.
translation.ja: とにかくフォロワー数以外にも

translation.en: It's about content, trust, interest, and engagement.
translation.ja: 内容や信頼性見た人の反応が大事なんです

translation.en: Excuse me, but the French are masters of social media.
translation.ja: でもフランス人はＳＮＳに詳しい

translation.en: True.
But Americans invented it,
translation.ja: でもアメリカ人が作った

translation.en: which is why I hope to become a valuable member of your team
translation.ja: だから私がここにいれば

translation.en: by adding an American point of view to your fabulous French clients.
translation.ja: アメリカ人の視点で助言できる

translation.en: [in French] It's a disaster.
Paul.
-[Paul] What? -Who is that girl?
It was one of the terms of the sale. -They send us one of their people. -[boss sighs]
translation.ja: 〈受け入れるのが買収の条件なんだ〉

translation.en: -How long do we have to put up with this? -[sighs] Well, until she decides to leave.
[Paul] Quoi ?
With me as her boss, we'll see how long she lasts.
translation.ja: 〈私にいつまで耐えられるかしら〉

translation.en: Right, I have to go.
[Emily, in English] It's amazing, isn't it?
The entire city looks like Ratatouille.
It's beautiful.
So beautiful.
[boyfriend] Ah. Hey, how was the first day?
Great.
Okay, maybe a few things got lost in translation.
translation.ja: 多少 言葉の壁があるかな

translation.en: It took them a minute to realize I was me and not Madeline,
translation.ja: マデリンと間違われた

translation.en: but I really feel like I could be a big asset here.
translation.ja: でも戦力になれると思う

translation.en: Hey, look what I got.
translation.ja: ねえ これを見てよ

translation.en: [Emily gasps] Thank God! You're gonna love Paris.
translation.ja: あなたもパリが気に入る

translation.en: I don't want to spend another day in the most romantic city in the world
translation.ja: 愛の街にいるのに離れ離れなんて

translation.en: -without you. -I'll be there soon, okay?
Hurry. I miss you already here.
translation.ja: 早く来て　すでに寂しい

translation.en: Bye.
-[door slams heavily] -[Emily] Ugh, seriously?
God.
[softly] Okay.
Come on.
[grunts] This can't be happening. Come on.
Sorry, I... I thought this was my apartment. Fifth floor?
translation.ja: ごめんなさいここは５階の部屋では？

translation.en: This is the fourth floor.
Fifth floor.
Right.
[chuckles] Uh, I'm Emily. Emily Cooper, your... your new neighbor.
translation.ja: エミリー･クーパー新しい住人

translation.en: American?
Oui. From Chicago.
Gabriel, French, from Normandy.
translation.ja: ノルマンディー出身のガブリエル

translation.en: [gasps softly] Oh, I know that beach. Saving Private Ryan.
translation.ja: 「プライベート･ライアン」で見た

translation.en: -What? -D-Day?
-Uh, anyway. -[both chuckle]
Nice to meet you, neighbor.
[in French] Good morning, miss.
Merci. Have un bonne journée.
translation.ja: メルシー よいイチニチを

translation.en: -♪ Get back to the beat... ♪ -[in English] Oh, my God.
-♪ We ain't got no hope ♪ -Oh, my God.
♪ I see you in the darkness, baby ♪
-♪ Surrounded by the moonlight, baby ♪ -Mm. Oh, my God.
translation.ja: 〝フォロワー 53人〞 〝バターとチョコ最高〞 〝バターとチョコ最高〞 最高 最高

translation.en: Sylvie, it's Emily. Um, are we closed today, or is there a national holiday I don't know about?
translation.ja: シルヴィー 今日は休業日？それとも祝日？

translation.en: 'Cause I've been hanging around here for two hours and...
-[brakes squeak] -What are you doing?
I've been here since 8:30.
Pourquoi ? We open at 10:30.
-[cell phone chimes softly] -[energetic music playing]
Hi Patricia. I'm wondering if I can share some ideas I have
translation.ja: パトリシアアイデアを共有させて

translation.en: about how we might enhance our social media engagement. I'm so excited about the potential here.
translation.ja: ＳＮＳの反応をもっと増やすことができる

translation.en: [translator, in French] Patricia, I'd like to share some ideas
translation.ja: 〈パトリシアアイデアを共有させて〉

translation.en: about how we might enhance our social media engagement.
-[in English] Do you wanna have lunch? -No, I'll have a cigarette.
translation.ja: ランチは？ たばこで十分

translation.en: Uh, I have a... bad stomach.
[clicks tongue] I have a previous engagement.
-Excusez-moi ! [sighs] -[woman] Laurent! Sybil!
[in Mandarin] Apologize to the lady!
[in French] I'm sorry. Can I buy you another one?
translation.ja: 〈すみません新しいのを買います〉

translation.en: [in English] Sorry, I don't speak French.
translation.ja: フランス語は話せない

translation.en: -Ah, American? -[Emily] Yes.
But did you think that I was French?
Honestly, no. I was being polite. You... look American.
translation.ja: 本当はアメリカ人だと思った

translation.en: Are you from Indiana?
-Chicago. -[woman] Oh. I was close.
translation.ja: シカゴ インディアナポリスの高校に行ってた

translation.en: I went to junior high in Indianapolis.
translation.ja: インディアナポリスの高校に行ってた

translation.en: -Oh, cool. No way! Why? -[woman] Mm-hm.
translation.ja: そうなんだ　どうして？

translation.en: Ah, long story. Very boring. [chuckles]
The story and... Indianapolis.
translation.ja: インディアナポリスもね

translation.en: But the girls, they look like you. Nice.
translation.ja: でも人はよかったあなたみたいに

translation.en: -Are those your children? -[woman] No, I'm their nanny.
translation.ja: お子さん？ 子守をしてるの

translation.en: [in Mandarin] Laurent! Stay where I can see you.
translation.ja: 〈ロラン見える所にいなさい〉

translation.en: [sighs, in English] I'm teaching them Mandarin.
How long have you been here?
Uh... almost a year. From Shanghai.
But my mother's from Korea. Another long, boring story.
translation.ja: 母は韓国の人だけどね話すと長くなる

translation.en: -Do you love it? -Uh, yes, of course I love Paris.
translation.ja: パリはどう？ もちろん大好き

translation.en: -And the food is so delicious. -[Emily] Mm.
The fashion, so chic.
The lights, so magical.
But the people... so mean.
translation.ja: でも人は すごく意地悪

translation.en: -I mean, they can't all be mean. -Oh, yes, they can.
translation.ja: 常にじゃない 常にだよ

translation.en: Chinese people are mean behind your back. -French people, mean to your face. -[Emily] Mm.
translation.ja: 中国人が陰で言うことを面と向かって言う

translation.en: -But you're on vacation here, so... -Oh, no. Actually, I work here.
translation.ja: でも旅行なら… パリのマーケティング企業で働いてる

translation.en: I have a job with a French marketing firm.
translation.ja: パリのマーケティング企業で働いてる

translation.en: -[woman] Seriously? -Yeah. Well, so you know.
translation.ja: 本当？　じゃあ分かるよね

translation.en: Well, I just started.
Oh.
-Do you have any friends in Paris? -Uh, no.
translation.ja: パリに友達は？ いない

translation.en: Um... but my boyfriend's coming next week to visit, so...
translation.ja: でも来週 彼氏が遊びに来る

translation.en: Are you lonely?
No... uh...
-Sometimes. [chuckles softly] -[clicks tongue] Give me your phone.
translation.ja: 時々ね 電話 貸して

translation.en: -[Emily] Uh... -Okay, so here's my number.
[clicks tongue] You're lonely, you text me, we have dinner. I'm Mindy.
translation.ja: 寂しくなったら連絡して ミンディー

translation.en: Emily.
Nice to meet you.
-French people do this. -Oh.
Sybil! Laurent!
-[in French] You're not my mother! -I want an ice cream!
translation.ja: 〈ママじゃない〉 〈アイス欲しい〉

translation.en: -[Mindy] Ugh. -[camera shutter clicks] -["Aujourd'hui" playing] -[phone locks]
translation.ja: 〝フォロワー 72人＃パレ･ロワイヤルでバトルロワイヤル〞

translation.en: [in English] What is "la plouc"?
It's a little term of endearment, like, um, mon petit chou, la plouc...
translation.ja: 親愛を表す呼び方だよ

translation.en: Nice. [chuckles] Don't worry about it.
translation.ja: いい意味だ　気にするな

translation.en: [translator on laptop] La plouc.
-[laptop chimes] -[translator] The hick.
Sorry, I don't speak French.
translation.ja: フランス語は話せない

translation.en: Oh, I'm sorry. Um, is the seat free?
translation.ja: 失礼　席は空いてる？

translation.en: -Uh, yes... yes, please. Yeah. -[man] Yeah? Okay.
translation.ja: もちろん どうぞ よし

translation.en: Thank you.
-Ah, Emily. Ah... -Luc! Hi.
translation.ja: エミリー あら リュック

translation.en: I... I just want to say I am sorry for this.
translation.ja: あのこと 謝りたかったんだ

translation.en: I... I do not agree to calling you "la plouc."
translation.ja: ラ･プルックって呼ぶのは反対だ

translation.en: And... I can, uh...?
Y-- yes.
You know... [inhales]
-Mm, I'm good. -Ah? Okay.
You know, we are all a little afraid of you.
translation.ja: 僕たちは君のことが怖いんだ

translation.en: What?
-Afraid of me? -Mm-hm. How?
Y-- your ideas.
They are more new. Maybe they are better.
translation.ja: 新しいし優れてるかも

translation.en: -[chuckles] -Now you are here, and,
uh, maybe we feel we have to work harder,
translation.ja: 仕事がキツくなりそうだと感じてる

translation.en: make more money.
It's a balance.
Ex-- exactly. A balance.
And I think the Americans have the wrong balance.
translation.ja: アメリカ人のバランスはよくない

translation.en: You live to work. We work to live.
translation.ja: 君たちは働くために生きてる僕たちは生きるために働く

translation.en: Yes, it's good to make money, but what you say is success,
translation.ja: 稼ぐのは悪くないけど 成功を求めるのは何かの罰みたいだ

translation.en: I say is punishment.
translation.ja: 成功を求めるのは何かの罰みたいだ

translation.en: But... I enjoy work...
translation.ja: だけど 仕事が好きなの

translation.en: and accomplishment. It... It makes me happy.
translation.ja: それに成功したら幸せでしょ

translation.en: Work makes you happy?
Yes. I mean, it's... it's... it's why I'm here. For work.
translation.ja: だってここに来たのは仕事のためだもの

translation.en: And look where it's brought me. To this beautiful city.
translation.ja: しかもこんなに美しい街だしね

translation.en: Maybe you don't know what it is to be happy. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 幸せとは何か分かってないんだね

translation.en: Or maybe that's a little arrogant.
translation.ja: あなたは少し高慢かも

translation.en: Ah. You came to Paris and you don't speak French.
translation.ja: パリに来てフランス語を話さない

translation.en: That is arrogant.
More ignorant than arrogant. [sighs]
Well, let's call it the arrogance of ignorance.
translation.ja: 無知の高慢とでも呼ぼう

translation.en: I'm sorry if I offended you.
Oh, I'm not offended by anything.
I see you tomorrow, Emily. Mm-hm?
Ah. Don't be early.
Oh, hey. There you are.
Is everything okay?
Yeah, I just finally got home from work.
It's 3:00 a.m. here.
Oh... whoops.
It's 7:00 p.m. here.
What are you doin'?
Sleeping.
I miss you so much.
And I miss you too.
-Hello? Doug? -[rustling on phone]
Get naked with me.
Are we having cybersex?
Well... if you insist.
-Hold on. [yawns] -[rustling on phone]
[sighs] You better not be recording this.
No. Never.
Oh, wow. You are so beautiful.
translation.ja: 君って本当にキレイだね

translation.en: Mm, thanks.
Uh, so, um... [exhales]
...you do you, and...
I'll do me.
[sighs] M'kay.
[breathing heavily] That feel good?
-[exhales] Yeah. -How good?
-[pants, moans] -Oh, you're so sexy.
I feel...
Oh, my God.
I feel overwhelmed. I... [breathing heavily]
I feel like myself but not myself, and...
translation.ja: 自分が自分じゃないみたい

translation.en: it's all so crazy.
It's crazy, but it's... it's nice, and...
it's kinda sexy, but...
And I...
Doug?
[distorted] Oh, wow.
-Doug? Babe? -[distorted moaning]
Doug?
Oh.
There you are.
[softly] Okay.
[exhales] Okay.
Oh...
my God.
